result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:36 PM Defendant Aaron Douglas Blazier appeared by phone. Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Aaron Douglas Blazier.  Attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant to contact State Public Defender's Office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:12 PM Defendant Aaron Douglas Blazier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Aaron Douglas Blazier.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address and date of birth verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond set of $25.00   with conditions, Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license or insurance. Maintain absolute sobriety. Adjourned initial appearance October 19, 2022 at 1:00 pm.

Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license. Maintain absolute sobriety.
